data.description:
Pauer View, lets you view your 2D and 360° photos taken on a 360 Camera without having to use a desktop computer to transfer your pictures to your Meta Quest VR headset.

Enjoy your VR pictures with your family and friends using your Meta Quest VR headset as a gallery for your 360 degree pictures quickly and simply. Create slideshows quickly and start sharing your memories!

Explicitly supported devices:
* GoPro Max
* Insta360
* HTTP image servers

To find out more visit: https://pauerview.softpauer.com/

We will be adding more as we learn about them, so if your camera is missing, email us at pauerview@softpauer.com

changelog.change_log:
Version 1.0

Additions

- Added haptics for controllers
- Added support for sorting lists
- Added button to remove slide from show
- Can now manually change 3D image projection type
- Added video controls
- Added tooltips for controller buttons
- Added brightness, contrast and saturation controls to image
- Moved projection and advanced menus into the control bar
- Slideshows will now automatically prefill their name
- Added new editor and viewer modes
  - This will allow an editor to customize the viewable content in a slideshow for a viewer. The viewer mode has reduced functionality and is only able to move through the slideshow
- Added sort button to "Create slideshow" menu

Reworks

- Menu movement is snappier and is more tolerent to head movements before moving
- User can now continue using the app while downloading, clicking on the download bar will return the user to the download menu
- Made text bigger for easier viewing
- Menus are now much closer

Bug Fixes

- Fixed an issue where permissions would constantly be requested
- Fixed a few of the visual states for buttons
- Fixed an issue where all images with dual fisheye projection were flipped

Known issues

- Downloading from a GoPro Max will sometimes fail the first time but will succeed on any attempts after
- Video handle won't move while dragging
- Dual fisheye videos sometimes out of sync
- Brightness contrast etc sliders don't always get remembered picture to picture
- White spots at the poles of the viewing area when viewing a video

### Version 0.9

- Added support for video
- Improved UX
- Added automatic image projection detection
  - This currently doesn't have a manual override but is planned to in the future
- Downloads will now happen in the background
  - The user must currently still wear the headset while downloads are occurring, this will be looked into for a future update
- Deselecting a slide from a slideshow should now prevent it from being shown when viewing the slideshow

#### Known issues

- Downloading from a GoPro Max will sometimes fail the first time but will succeed on any attempts after
- Ghosting and fractal effects on equirectangular and dual fisheye projection types

Version 0.8

- Fixed bluetooth connection issues
- Fixed an issue where the app would crash when repeatedly opening the 'New Slideshow' menu
- Fixed an issue where downloading from 2 separate cameras would show the images from both cameras, not just the most recent one
- Fixed an issue where downloading from a GoPro would always fail on the the 1st connection
- Fixed an issue where slideshows were being duplicated
- Fixed an issue where slideshows weren't being displayed on 1st load

Version 0.7



- App now supports downloads for Insta360 cameras

- App now supports downloads from a HTTP file server

  - The server currently must have autoindex on in the config settings for this feature to work

Version 0.6

- 2-dimensional and 3-dimensional photos support rotation
- Rendering automatically detects and renders 360° and non-360° media appropriately
- Fixed an issue where cameras were not being detected
- Fixed an issue where placeholders were not being removed

Version 0.5

- 2-dimensional rendering now supports dynamic aspect ratios
- Fix pause and play buttons to correctly reflect the state of play
- Fix permissions missing errors
- Changed UI navigation to show when beginning a slide and hide when returning to the home screen
- UI navigation now hidden on start
- Removed external read/write permission
- Now cannot progress through camera connection flow without necessary permissions enabled
- Remove GoPro Cam from the list of devices shown
Initial release. Please note we only support the GoPro 360 Max camera for this release. More support for other devices coming soon!
